course.subject: IELM
course.name: Advanced Quality Technology and Data Analytics
course.description: Fundamental principles of quality technology and data analytics, including planning, designing, and analyzing statistical experiments, randomized block, factorial, and fractional factorial experimental designs, and other advanced statistical learning and machine learning techniques with application to quality and industrial engineering.

reviews.author: Winnie
reviews.comment_content: A course that briefly covers methods applicable in data analytics. Prof encourages the use of R in applying the methods in the group project, but Python is also fine.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof is a nice guy, but the slides can be boring.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you don't screw up the midterm and did the project well, the grading is pretty fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Presentation on a technique to analyze data, e.g. linear regression, neural networks, kernel method, etc. Prof pays extra attention on the presentation and expects you to extend the content of topics covered in the lectures.
Group project involves the analysis of industrial data to identify features via statistical methods learned in class.
